titleproper.value: Guide to the New-York Historical Society Ephemera Collection<lb/>1800s-2010s<lb/> <num>PR 264</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-12-30T16:31:33</date>

extent.value: (6 boxes, 2 albums, 1 drawer flat folders, and oversize flat)

abstract.value: The Ephemera Collection (formerly called the Ephemera File) contains a variety of print ephemera, such as advertisements, calendars, theatrical posters, political broadsides, event announcements, etc.

p.value:
Available by advance appointment only.  To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.<lb/>
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

The Ephemera Collection was compiled by New-York Historical Society from various sources. 510 advertising postcards were donated by Bert Hansen in 2000.  Erotic advertising cards were donated by photographer Andreas Feininger in the 1990's, and the Schreyer family in the early 2000's.  The remaining items were acquired through staff or individual donations.  It is anticipated that items will continue to be added.

Series V, Erotic advertising cards, includes loose paper cards advertising phone sex hotlines, adult establishments and the like. This material is extremely graphic.  Most of these were donated by photographer Andreas Feininger.  N-YHS staff collected several others during the late 1980s and early 1990s.

subject.value: Business enterprises -- New York (State)  -- New York.
Sex-oriented businesses -- New York (State)  -- New York.

dsc.value:
Series I: EphemeraScope and Contents

Series I, Ephemera, includes material relating to products (food, clothing, household items, etc.); establishments such as hotels and restaurants, charitable and other organizations; and cultural and political events, primarily in New York City.

Animals1960s-1990s, undated11Scope and Contents

Includes, among other documents, a dogwalker flyer with tear-off contact information; ticket to the Westminster Kennel Club Show at Madison Square Garden (1994); members pass for rides at the New York Zoological Society (1990); advertising picture postcard for Shar-Pei dogs; reprint of article "Horses in Old New York" by Benjamin Ladd Cook (autographed by Cook) (1961).

Antiques1957-circa 1990s12Scope and Contents

Includes, along other documents, business card for Baltimore County Stripper Inc (with price quote); name tag for the Ephemera Society of America conference; sales and show flyers and small pieces for Rhode Island Antiques Show (1988), a show in Pittsburgh Moose Lodge (1988), at the Greenwich (1988), "Modernism" at the Armory (1994); postcard for The Ross Group (poster sales); booklet for Manhattan Art & Antiques Center (1990s); flyer for antiques auction at Taylor & Taylor (1957).

Drugs and Medicines117Drugs and MedicinesFlat FilesFF-1Dry goods/Department stores - grocery and feed stores1892-2007, undated118Scope and Contents

Includes, among other documents, trade cards for Clark's O.N.T. spool cotton, Niagara starch, Hornby's grocer; a list of the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company's (A&P) branches in the U.S. on reverse of a large decorative chromolithograph and letter press depicting a bird and nest in a basket (gift of Linda Ferber, 2017); Whole Foods (Bowery location) brochure [2007]; manuscript bills and statements from W.H.H. Ransom & Son (1899), Arm & Hammer baking soda (1907); East River Milling Co. (1892), Auburn Tobacco Co (1929); cash register receipt from Dagostino (1986)

Dry Goods/Department Stores - clothing and fabric1857-circa 1994119Scope and Contents

Includes, among other documents, trade cards for Medford Fancy Goods, Charles Cohen; holiday greeting card from Montgomery Ward; Talbot Clothing Co. contest (guessing state-by-state 1896 presidential election results) (gift of Leo Hershkowitz); Devlin & Co circular/price list (1857); various small pieces from B. Altman; James McCreery & Co private sale invitation (circa 1927?); brochures and small pieces (circa 1990s) for Bloomingdale's, Lord & Taylor, Nordstrom.

Dry Goods/Department Stores -- Macy's (includes Thanksgiving Parade)120Dry Goods/Department StoresFlat FilesFF 1Events-General121Scope Note

Includes items from 150th anniversay of the U.S. Constitution, the U.S. Bicentennial, the 1899 parade for Admiral Dewey in NYC, the seating list for the 1948 Unification Dinner held at the Waldorf-Astoria, and the 1972 dedication of the American Museum of Immigration on Liberty Island.

includes "Mind map" of all the parties involved in the restoration of lower Manhattan after the World Trade Center attack on 9/1//2001.

Sugar Daddy candy (Nabisco brand) advertisement in the form of a broadside "Sugar Daddy News" featuring tennis player Bobby Riggs and a large photo of Riggs with tennis player Rosie Casals, continuing the "war of the sexes" theme from the Riggs/Billie Jean King match.

Immediate Source of Acquisition

Sugar Daddy poster donated by Harvey Spiller (accession PPAC.2017.30).

Politics and governmentFlat FilesFF-4Scope and Contents Note

Contains political protest posters, including Help End Demonstrations, a 1968 poster advertising a march and rally for peace. Martin Luther King Jr. was scheduled to speak at the rally; his widow Coretta Scott King read the notes from his speech "Ten Commandments on Vietnam."

Politics and government -- campaign buttons1950's-1980's11Scope and Contents

Includes campaing buttons for Dwight Eisnenhower, Adlai Stevenson, John F. Kennedy, Lyndon B. Johnson, Richard Nixon, George Mcgovern, Hubert Humphrey, George Wallace, Ronald Reagan, George Bush, and others. Also include buttons for local campaings and other political issues (impeachment, anti-Vietnam, etc.).

Series II: Prohibition-related ephemeraScope and Contents

Series II, Prohibition-related ephemera, includes speakeasy cards (advertising illicit bars that operated during the years of Prohibition), cartoons and caricatures, and other Prohibition and temperance related ephemera.

Disbound album of speakeasy cards and other prohibition-era ephemera51-2Speakeasy advertisements and ephemera53Speakeasy cards54Cartoons and caricatures55Clippings - "Speakeasy" by Lois Sobel57Clippings - Prohibition58Clippings - Collecting speakeasy cards59Temperance - cards and ephemera510Miscellaneous ephemera511Series III: Advertising postcardsScope and Contents

Series III, Advertising postcards, includes 510 postcards from the 1990s, which would have been found in bars, clubs, restaurants and other venues. The majority of these cards advertise New York businesses.

Advertising postcardscirca 1990's6Series IV: Ephemera albumsScope and Contents

Series IV, Ephemera albums, consists of three albums of pasted-in ephemera, including scraps and diecuts, advertisements and trade cards. Notable items include images promoting racial and ethnic stereotypes and images of Santa Claus.

Album 1circa 1900's7Album 2circa 1900's8Album 3 (disbound)circa 1900's12Provenance

This album was a gift of Maureen Howard, 2010

Series V: Erotic advertising cardsScope and Contents

Series V, Erotic advertising cards, includes loose paper cards advertising phone sex hotlines, adult establishments and the like. This material is extremely graphic. Photographer Andreas Feininger donated most of the items in Box 9 and 9A, including a dis-bound scrapbook of erotic advertisements. N-YHS staff collected some additional advertisement during the late 1980s and early 1990s. The material in box 10 was donated by the Schreyer family.
